intro: Stegnogramma dictyoclinoides, commonly known as the golden star moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and bright yellow-green coloration. The plant features elongated, strap-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Stegnogramma dictyoclinoides thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocky substrates or in forest undergrowth. Its unique morphology and vibrant color make it a notable species in botanical studies and ecological surveys.
